meanings.definition: The ability of blood vessels to constrict or dilate.
meanings.sent1: The vasoactivities of the blood vessels help regulate blood flow.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study vasoactivities to understand how blood vessels function.
meanings.sent3: The blood vessels were having a party, showing off their vasoactivities by dancing to the beat of the heart.
meanings.sent4: Her control over her vasoactivities was like a skilled conductor directing a symphony of blood flow.
meanings.sent5: The textbook explained vasoactivities with colorful diagrams to make it easier to remember.

meanings.definition: The actions or effects on blood vessels.
meanings.sent1: Exercise can have positive vasoactivities on the blood vessels.
meanings.sent2: Medications can sometimes alter vasoactivities in the body.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's vasoactivities were so powerful that even the blood vessels cheered for help.
meanings.sent4: The vasoactivities of nature's healing touch on the blood vessels were like a gentle breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The scientist observed the vasoactivities under the microscope, amazed by their intricate patterns.
